name: Define Data Input Mechanism
description: Establish a method for users to provide new data entries into the system, abstracting the specific type of data. This involves defining what information is required and how it will be captured.
purpose: Ensures a clear pathway exists for new information to be introduced, forming the basis of data management.
applicability_notes: Relevant whenever new information or items need to be added to a system or process, regardless of the domain. Examples include adding a new record, submitting a form, or creating a new item in a list.
examples_of_usage: Adding a new contact to an address book
Submitting a new bug report for software
Creating a new post on a forum
typical_outputs: Defined input fields and submission process

name: Establish Data Display
description: Define how existing data items are presented to the user, allowing for retrieval and review. This includes determining the layout, order, and content to be shown.
purpose: Enables users to see and interact with the information managed by the system.
applicability_notes: Applicable in any system that stores and presents information to users. This could involve lists, grids, detailed views, or summaries.
examples_of_usage: Listing available products in an e-commerce site
Showing a list of pending tasks in a productivity app
Displaying search results from a database query

name: Define State Modification
description: Create a mechanism to alter the status or properties of existing data items. This involves defining the possible states and the triggers for changing between them.
purpose: Allows for dynamic updates to data, reflecting changes in its lifecycle or user interaction.
applicability_notes: Essential for interactive systems where items can change over time or based on user actions. This step focuses on the process of changing a state, not the specific state itself.
examples_of_usage: Marking an email as read or unread
Changing a task's priority from low to high
Updating an order status from 'pending' to 'shipped'

name: Establish Data Removal
description: Implement a process for permanently deleting specific data items from the system. This includes confirmation steps and handling of associated data if necessary.
purpose: Provides a way to manage data volume and remove obsolete or unwanted information.
applicability_notes: Necessary for systems where data may become irrelevant, needs to be purged for privacy reasons, or simply to manage storage. The focus is on the process of removal.
examples_of_usage: Deleting a temporary file after use
Removing a user account from a system
Discarding a draft message before sending
